name: achalasia
background:
## Basic Information

Achalasia is a rare esophageal motility disorder characterized by the failure of the lower esophageal sphincter (LES) to relax and by the absence of esophageal peristalsis.
history:
## Mild Symptoms of Achalasia

### Difficulty Swallowing (Dysphagia)
In the early stages of achalasia, patients may experience mild difficulty swallowing (dysphagia), which tends to progressively worsen over time.
differential_diagnosis:
## Achalasia

Achalasia is a primary esophageal motility disorder characterized by the failure of the lower esophageal sphincter (LES) to relax and the absence of normal esophageal peristalsis.
examination:
## Inspection

During the physical examination of a patient suspected to have otosclerosis, inspection is a critical component.
investigation:
## Radiology

### X-ray
For achalasia, a barium swallow X-ray is a common radiological investigation.
treatment:
## Wait and See

In the management of achalasia, a "wait and see" approach is typically not recommended due to the progressive nature of the disease.
prognosis:
## Prognosis of Achalasia

Achalasia is a chronic esophageal motility disorder characterized by the inability of the lower esophageal sphincter (LES) to relax.
